verses.verse: {Praise to the Victorious God} d Lord , you are my God; I will exalt you and praise your name, for you have done marvelous things, plans made long ago in faithfulness and truth.

For you have made the city a heap of rubble, the fortified city into a ruin; the foreigners'citadel {So 1QIsa a MT; MT mss LXX read citadel of arrogant people} is no longer a city it will never be rebuilt!
Therefore strong peoples will glorify you; cities of ruthless nations will revere you.

For you have been a stronghold for the poor, a stronghold for the needy in distress, a shelter from the storm and a shade from the heat for the blistering attack {1QIsa a MT lack attack} from the ruthless is like a rainstorm beating against a wall,
and the noise of foreigners is like the heat of the desert. Just as you subdue heat by the shade of clouds, so the victory songs of violent men will be stilled.

{Celebration of the Righteous} d "On this mountain, {I. e. Mount Zion; cf. 24:23} the Lord of the Heavenly Armies will prepare for all peoples a banquet of rich food, a banquet of well-aged wines rich food full of marrow, and refined wines of the finest {1QIsa a MT lack the finest} vintage
And on this mountain, {I. e. Mount Zion; cf. 24:23} he will swallow up the burial {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks burial} shroud that enfolds all peoples, the veil that is spread over all nations

he has swallowed up {So 1QIsa a MT ms ; MT reads And he will swallow up ; cf. LXX Syr Theodotian 1Cor 15:54} death forever! Then the Lord God will wipe away the tears from all faces, and he will take away the disgrace of his people from the entire earth." for the Lord has spoken.

"And you {So 1QIsa a Syriac; 4QIsa c MT read he ; LXX reads they} will say at that time, {Lit. say on that day} Â«Look! It's the Lord! {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack It's the Lord} T his is our God! We waited for him, and he saved us. This is the Lord ! We waited for him, so let us rejoice, and we will {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads and let us} be glad that he has saved us."

{The Misery of Moab} d For the Lord's power {Lit. hand} will rest on this mountain, {I. e. Mount Zion; cf. 24:23} but the Moabites will be trodden down beneath him, just as straw is trodden down in the slime of {Lit. in the water of ; so 1QIsa a MT; MT qere reads in ; LXX reads in wagons} a manure pit.
They will spread out their hands in the thick of it, just as swimmers spread out their hands to swim, but the Lord will bring down their pride, together with the cleverness of their hands.
He brings down the high fortifications of your walls and lays them low; he will raze them {Or reach ; so 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa c MT read he casts them} to the ground, right down to the dust.
